text:
A big coffee nose. An Americano with one sugar complimented by good malt flavour.

Rated by BrewTom

Pours a very dark brown with a huge frothy tan khaki head that leaves a lot of lacing. The aromas were a little lacking but consisted of caramel and roasted malt. Flavors are made of nuts, coffee, caramel and some milk. A creamy and fairly light body with a bitter and dry finish. This was more sweet stout-like than it was brown ale but delicious nonetheless.

Megnyerő ábrázatú ital, sötét kólaszínű testén tojáshéj habkorona ékeskedik, festeni sem lehetne szebb brown ale-t. Édeskés, pörkölt malátás, barnacukros illatai csalogatóan hatnak, ám az élmény a kortyolást követően válik teljessé. Hosszú kávés, alaposan megédesített, karakteresre pörkölt aromái visszafogott súlyú testben találnak otthonra, összességében azonban kellemes élményt nyújtanak, könnyedén fogyasztható, mégis ízletes karaktert alkotnak.

Pours brown getting close to black in the glass, big but fast fading beige head, lot f lacing. Aroma is roasted malts and strong coffee. Taste is very rich of espresso coffee, with roasted malts and chocolate, heavy hoppy bitterness. Sticky, full body, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. Very well made "breakfast beer", deep and tasty, close to a stout. Lovely.
On keg at hanging bat. Pours hazy brown. Nose of dark chocolate, espresso. Taste is full bodied, dry coffee grind, cherries, dark chocolate.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Pours dark brown. Aroma is chocolate, sweet malts, toasted malts. Body is sweet, but still rather light, again toasted malts and caramel. Palate is rather dry, actually. Good!
Tap @ Jopen Waarderpolder. Black. Mocha, roast, dark chocolate and cacao in the aroma. Malty sweet flavor, roast, dark chocolate, cacao. Some late bitterness. Low on carbon. Nice.

On tap at Jopen Proeflokaal. Murky dark brown colour, thin beige head. Aroma of coffee, milk chocolate, praline, nuts, brown malts. Flavour is sweet, nutty, praline, toffee, coffee grounds, more coffee, fruity bitter finish. Medium bodied. Nice.
Tap at beerlovers bar. Pours dark brown. Small white head. Smell is pure coffee. Taste is intense. Coffee, mild bitterness. To much coffee for me, but well made for sure.

Butelka 330ml (BB 07.03.2019). Ciemno-brązowe, przejrzyste, rubinowe pod światło. Piana beżowa, bardzo obfita z wyraźnym krążkowaniem podczas opadania. W aromacie ciemne słody, nieco zboża i delikatna nuta czekoladowo-kawowa choć wyraźna głownie na samym początku a potem zanika. Smak to jednak głównie kawa, świeżo parzona i intensywna z wyraźną, palono-chmielową goryczką i leciutkim kwaskiem na finiszu. Piwo jest pełne w odbiorze o gładkiej fakturze i całkiem pijalne i mimo, że porannej kawy nie zastąpi to na wieczór jest przyjemnym napitkiem.

Cola coloured pour with big fizzy beige head, the head settles to a tight 1cm foam. Cafe latte, chocolate, a little nutty aroma. Taste is sweetish, milky coffee, a bit of sweet chocolate, ends with a decent amount of roasty and coffee bitterness.

Dark brown. Malty, with moderate coffee, chocolate and notes of spice. Sweetish, fairly full taste that finishes dry and solidly bitter. Full body, and a smooth texture. Overall, a very good brown ale. Sweeter, tastier and more bitter than most other brown ales. Good coffee flavour.

Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with medium head. Smells intensely of fresh ( expensive ) roasted black coffee. Tastes follows with amazing coffee taste, dark caramels, cocoa. There is good bitterness to the beer, slight sweetness at the end. I love it.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (aus dem Weihnachtskalender von To Øl). Schwarzbraun mit intensiver Schaumkrone. Stark dominierende Kaffeearomen in der Nase und im Antrunk.

Tap at Jopen Waarderpolder. Clear dark brown with beige head. Lots of nuts, dark chocolate, sweet coffee, mocca. Lots of coffee candy and dark cocoa basically. Over medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied. Nice one!

Tap at Jopen Proeflokaal far away from the center. Black with creme head. Big roasted chocolate malts, coffee, barley, caramel, berries, light roasted hazelnut. Moderate sweet and quite a deep roastiness, mild bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation and creamy feel. Good coffee beer!
Drank with Rik in at Pivo 100 in Bratislava before we did the tasiting 08-02-2017. Very nice beer. Soft creaminess, a bit coffee and sweetness. Rich, full taste.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, nuts, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/dark brown beer with heavy yeast and with a medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, chocolate, nuts and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Amazing idea to bring lactose and coffee? together in a Brown Ale. Great appearance, flavour and palate; but the aroma could have been stronger. All those hops are definitely needed, but are never distinctly noticeable.
Bardzo przyjemny aromat: paloność, kawa, mleczna czekolada, shake czekoladowy, laktoza. W smaku dominuje kawa i laktoza. Nie jest źle, ale brakuje tu ciała, jest wręcz wodniście.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a very dark brown to opaque with a small off-white to beige head and an aroma of coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, toffee and cherries. Medium sweet taste with a bitter finish and some sugarry sweetness sticking to the lips.
33 cl bottle - Although I am a coffee and beer lover, I did not think too much of this beer. A bit too bitter and not enough body to get me going. Nice beige foam however.
Draft - Big and rich espresso and chocolate notes. Jet brown with a decent beige head. Big and perfumy dark roast coffee. Big, roasty and nice sweetness and along complex fruity finish. Well done.

Marrón intenso con reflejos rubíes profundos, espuma muy cremosa color canela suave, perfecta estética. En nariz muy intensa, chocolate, café, intensos recuerdos a regaliz y notas a cebada tostada, lúpulo moderado a frutas tropicales y cítricos que complementa bien a la malta. En boca es pesada, casi plena con un carbónico propio del estilo. Los sabores están muy integrados y bien compensados, chocolate, nueces, cargada de lúpulo muy bien compensado con los sabores dulces de la malta y el agrio-tostado de las maltas más oscuras junto al café en el retrogusto. De trago largo, REDONDA. Entiendo que debe catalogarse como una American Brown Ale,
Bottle from my ex-colleagues. Thanks a lot! Pours brown with thick tan head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, malt. Taste is bitter with coffee, malt, chocolate, hops and somewhat roasty.

Aug. 16. A 0.33 l bottle at Craft Room, Zagreb. This one poured almost a black body with quite a big head, off white of course. Cocoa-coffee aroma, very pleasant. Flavor was lightly sweet, although it could be said it was coffee dominated, this was balanced out nicely with caramel, cocoa, fruity toasted malt, and chalky lactic note. Some subtle bitterness grown up later on, taking a big part in its long finish. Otherwise, of course, it followed the pleasant coffee-cocoa profile. Full bodied, very tasty, well elaborated.

Bottle. Teku. Deep brown with big, thick, light brown head. Perfect head retention and lacing. Aroma are moderate roasted malts - mainly coffee (espresso), also light nutty and caramel notes. Taste is medium bitter esp. in the end of degustation and aftertaste. Partly lightly acidic profile (probably due to coffee). Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is bitter, semi-dry with some caramel notes. In general nicely hopped brown ale, another one, which shows that this style could not be so boring ;)

Piwo w stylu ktorego niezbyt lubie. Piana kremowa srednia ale bardzo trwala, zdobi szklo. Kolor brazowo bordowy, mnostwo w aromacie kawy zmieszanej z grejfrurem z chmieli from US. W smaku takze jest ale laktoza zbyt oslodzila piwo daktyle w tle. Ja pijam kawe espresso i bez zadnych dodatkow. Tu mam slodka kawe w dodatku jakby z mlekiem. OK ale nie do konca sobie to tak wyobrazalem

Barwa ciemnobrązowa, piwo klarowne, piana piękna, obfita, długo utrzymująca się, wspaniale zdobi szkło. Piwo zdominowane przez kawę, zarówno w smaku, jak i w aromacie. Niskie wysycenie, goryczka wyraźnie zaznaczona.

Versa nel bicchiere di colore marrone scuro, con riflessi rosso rubino; la schiuma è abbondante, pannosa, fine, di colore beige, buona allacciatura ed ottima persistenza. Al naso si viene avvolti da un buon odore di caffè, seguito da una robusta quantità di luppolo, note di pino e terrose. In sottofondo qualche sentore di mandorla e di foglie di tabacco. Al palato non manca il sapore di caffè tostato tanto atteso, contornato da pane scuro e cioccolato amaro; confermata la sensazione olfattiva anche per quanto riguarda la componente luppolata, le note di pino e quelle terrose, che si fanno più insistenti. Il corpo è medio, così come la carbonazione; il finale è asciutto, con ancora la presenza costante di caffè.

Aroma: chocolate and sweet malt. 
Flavour: Chokolate with sweet fruits and caramel notes. Aftertaste is fairly bitter but well balanced with the sweetness. 
Colour: dark brown with a tan head.
Bottle at home, bought at Hopduvel, I believe. Best Brown Ale Ive had, but I love coffee. Caramel, coffee, complements nicely, very well done.

Nez ultra café, un fond boisé, des notes de poivrons, légèrement pimentée. 
Bouche pareille. Assez ronde, finale sèche, aqueuse. Longueur torrefiee, légèrement boisée.
Murky deep brown, lingering head. Aroma vanilla, cocoa. Palate and carbonation medium. Taste nuts, milk chocolate although a bit astringent, roasty finish. Nice, good choice for ladies :)
Bottle. Dark brown colour with stable huge head off. Aroma of coffee, chocolate. Taste of nuts, dark chocolate, roasted coffee,cocoa, Semisweet,semi bitter, nice one.

Brown to black pour with a single finger, espresso head. Aroma is full of coffee, kind of like freshly brewed coffee with a little cream. Lots of lace present. Taste is full on coffee, starts light, finishes with bitter roasted espresso. Long lingering espresso finish with is very dry.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2016 Full brown color, hazy. Little brown head. Not very aromatic, little coffee and chocolate. In flavor a lot of coffee, but well balanced, little sweet. Good mouthfeel, medium body and carbonation. Very nice beer.

Bottle. Dark brown colour, white head. Aroma is roasted, coffee, caramel, nuts, some vanilla. Taste is mostly roasted and coffe, nuts, caramel. Some sweetness. Roasted bitter aftertaste. A bit overcarbonated. Overall good.

Tap at Sviatok piva Myjava. Dark brown color, thick and stable beige head. Aroma is light roasty with coffee and dark chocolate, milky, lactose. Taste of milk coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate with decent bitterness. Nice balanced.
Lovely dark brown colour with good foamy head. Aroma is fresh roast coffee with sugar, tastes like that too with a little cocoa bitterness in the finish. Smooth mouth feel. Very drinkable.

33cl bottle. Dark caramel-brown pour with a medium height tan head with decent retention. Notes of roasted coffee, brewed coffee, citrus hops, grapefruit zest, lactose, unripe tropical fruit and a bit of sugar. Medium body, medium to high carbonation and a roasty, caramely bitter-sweet finish.

330ml bottle at home in Richmond, as To Øl Mochaccino Messiah Coffee Brown Ale, 7.0%. Very dark brown, opaque, foamy tan head leaves full lacing. Aroma is Americano, black pepper, instant coffee, ash. Body is frothy, soft carbonation. Taste is dark chocolate and coffee, ashy, hoppy floral vibes, oaty astringency, lovely balance and drinkability. A tasty beer, and deservedly a top 50 brown ale.
Sample from draft at brus, poured murky Brown with a tanned head. Nose of sweet caramel malts, prunes, toffee, toasted nuts, roasted coffee bitterness. Sticky texture

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Mochaccino Messiah by To ØL at PowiśleKawa orzechy rodzynki figi kandyzowane, troszke cytrusow, karmelu, slodkie, nieco alko, kapka lukrecji... Fajne bardzoOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle at home. Pours murky brown. Nose is coffee, toasted malts, toffee, nuts. Taste is coffee, nutty malts, bitter hoppyness, light roast. Ok but not impressed.

Bouteille de 330 ml dégustée chez La Succursale (Montréa, QC) au coût de 13,00$. Arôme: Légère odeur de café et de fruité. Apparence: La couleur est brune avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de café avec une ponte de caramel fruité. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de café en arrière goût. (Rating #7000)

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2016 Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Aroma of coffee, caramel, light roasted malt. Clear dark brown with lasting off-white head. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter from also malt and coffee. Medium body, oily feel, light sweet coffee finish.
Dunkelbraun rötlich im Glas, leichte röstaromen in der Nase, schokoladig süßlich im antrunk, leichte bittere im Abgang, leichte röstaromen

On tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a dark, reddish brown with a medium sized, beige head. Aroma has lots of coffee, intese caramel. Not malty caramel, but intense candy caramel. Hazelnuts, light roast and quite a lots of hops. taste is sweet with lots of caramel up front, but gets taken over by a hoppy and coffee bitterness mid sip that lingers. Average carbonation and a pretty oily body.

Aroma: coffee, espresso, roasted malts, mocha, and very surprising hoppy floral and fruity aromas. 
Appearance: deep brown color, with huge light brown head with very good retention and very good lacing. Very creamy foam. made from tiny bubbles. Too dark to say, but it seems clear.
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light sourness. Coffee flavor, toasted malts, and an acid touch.
Palate: light-to-medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, short dry and slightly acid (maybe because of the lactose) and fruity finish.
Overall: nice aroma and good looking. The taste is quite good and well balanced. Not my favourite beer, but a good one.

Hazy brown beer, beige head. Malty, bitter chocolate and heavy coffee in the aroma. Taste is coffee but lighter than expected. Malt, a touch of burnt toffee but it really is all about the coffee, just a dash of dark chocolate.

0.33 l bottle at Svijet piva (World of Beers), Zagreb. Shared with lovely Anja, Shotgun Fred and Marko. Last year. Dark brown, lasting tan head. Malty and fruity, caramel, but coffee very light. Light sweetness, metallic notes. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, coffee finish. I wasnt impressed, though everyone else seemed to be. It was the last beer of the evening, maybe one to many for tasting. Will try again.

Gyönyörű, tartós, kávészínű hab. Fekete színű. Illata kávés, de inkább fekete csokis, kissé konyakos illatú. Íze fenséges, kávés, de nem savanykás szerencsére. Olyan, mintha arábika kávé lenne benne, valószínűleg így is van. Utóíze kávés (naná), kis gyümölcsös felhanggal, és pont a megfelelő ideig tart. Ez az egyik legjobb sör, amit valaha ittam.
Pours deep brown colour with some thick head. Flavor of roasted dark coffee, nuts, some lactose, maltiness, caramel. Lasting roasted aftertaste. A bit like an oatmeal stout.
Flaske 0.33L på Cafe Sånn med djoeye. Mørk mørk Brun med beige skum. Karamell, kaffetoner, frisk. Føles ikke som en 7%. Lettere brown ale

Beige good top, ultra dark dark brown beer.
Herbal hops, brown caramels, plumz, coffee notes and berries to the nose.
Tastes brown caramels, soft hops, fresh lemonish 
grass, fruity chocolate in a cup o coffee.
Semi dry aloe veraish fresh malty fruity finish with coffee n berries.
Nice body, semi dry, slightly too eager carbonation.
Very tasty, very dark brown.
[33cl btl abv7% at CafeSånn]

Bottle. Black and poured with a big head. Coffee and chocolate dominates but not as much as I anticipated. Very smooth and left lots of lacing. Easy to drink and very well balanced. Despite what I anticipated no dlavour took over. Really worth trying.
Decent beer, not as coffe forward as expected. It has a nice bitter coffee roast though and its pleasantly followed through by notes of chocolate and some grassy hops.

butelka 330ml. Kolor: bardzo ciemny brąz, czarny, piwo lekko mętne. Piana bardzo dobra, ładny lacing. Aromat: zdecydowanie kawa. Kawa zabija wszystko inne. W smaku na pierwszym planie kawa, po sekundzie słodycz, ciemne owoce, niesamowite polaczenie kawy z ciemnym, słodkim brown ale. Bardzo rześkie piwo z dominującym smakiem kawy i średnia aczkolwiek pozostającą długo na języku goryczką. Bardzo ciekawe piwo, polecam!

Pours opaque burgundy black, with a light brown head which heavily laces the glass during recession. Aroma is chocolate, espresso, vanilla and leather. Taste is major coffee, chocolate sweet, cocoa bitter, roasty, vanilla sweet. Full body with a creamy mouthfeel.
0,33l Fles gedeeld met lion. Donker bruin met een lichte fijne schuimkraag. Geur en smaak is koffie en mokka niet verkeerd. Maar wat simpel

Bottle; pours dark brown with a tan head; aroma of roasted malt with a little chocolate, coffee, and hints of nuts; taste is mostly roasted malt with chocolate and coffee; finish is lightly bitter; the coffee aroma and taste is not as dominate as I expected but still this beer is quite good

Ciemno brunatne. Piana obfita, brązowa, drobna. 
W aromacie czekolada, nuta słodyczy, ale nie bardzo wysoka.
Smakuje jak nie za słodka kawa z dodatkiem alkoholu. 
Wychodzi lekko ziołowa nuta chmielu, ale tutaj doskonale pasuje. 
Wychodzi Centennial.
W smaku czekoladowe, gorzkawe. Trochę nut orzechowych. Lekka wanilia. 
Bardzo przyjemny smak. Alkohol doskonale zamaskowany. 
W smaku niezauważalny. Daje o sobie znać po dłuższej chwili grzaniem w przełyku. 
W odczuciu dość gładkie, kojarzy się z laktozą. 
Bardzo dobre. 
Zdradliwie pijalne.

On tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem. Body is dark brown, head is medium, creamy, brownish, average lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is dried fruits, flavor is brown, dried fruits, herbs, pasta, honey, caramel, milk chocolate. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty chocolate medium bittersweet. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy dessert beer, tasty, good one.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 On tap. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 14/01/2016
Color marron, espuma beige, aromas cafe, maltosa, sabor malta, dulce, cafe, Rica.

brown color
aroma of coffee and dark chocolate
flavor full of coffee, light hop and bitterness
nice brown ale

Tap at Roundhouse with Alex. Translucent brown cocoa pour with some tannish head. Aroma is powerful coffee with some chocolate underneath - very coffee-like, more so than many stouts. Taste follows - delicious chocolate and coffee flavors with a healthy amount of bitterness from the hops. Smooth palate without being too rich. Really nice brown ale, one of my favorites.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours hazy dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aromas of cocoa, roasted coffee, malt, sweet dark fruits. Taste is roasty, dark chocolate, vanilla, bitter coffee. Nice!
On tap at Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Dark with a beige head. Sweet malty aroma, coffee. Taste is bitter sweet, coffee, bitter roasted aftertaste. Nice

Pours a dark brown color, topped with a decently sized and stable tan colored head. Lovely aroma, combination of coffee and chocolate, with some subtle grassy notes in the back. Taste is mildly sweet at first, a milky feel, a tad of bitterness with nice gentle coffee finish that lingers a bit in your mouth. Nice one, not too strong with not too excessive coffee presence. Very tasteful.
Cold espresso. Bitter hoppy aroma. Coffee beans with dry bitter aftertaste. Roasted flavour.

Malto, nocciole, caffè e zucchero caramellato: naso e palato sono dominati da questi aromi che si intrecciano con una discreta profondità ma il corpo è troppo lieve e manca quel mouthfeel cremoso o liquoroso che lavrebbe consacrata meglio.

Bottle from the Grumpy Goat in Reading. Plenty of body, slightly spiced with a strong hop character. I didnt really get the coffee flavours I was expecting from this. Its nice and tasty but doesnt have a wow factor.

From tap at Billies Bierkafetaria in Antwerp. Thick and frothy, dense, yellowish white head over a dark mahogany brown beer, notably darker than average for an Anglo-Saxon brown ale. Aroma of dried leaves, caramel, roasted pine nuts, cured meat, toasted or even burnt bread, dried berries, haemoglobin iron. Subdued candied sweetness in the onset, soft deep sourishness balancing it, soft carbo, dark fruits but in a clean way, nice caramelly, nutty and toasted maltiness, supple, filling with a coffeeish roasted accent in the background, firm leafy herbal and leafy, spicy hop bitterness in the finish, very long and drying, aromatic and clearly a lot more outspoken than normal for a brown ale. Very good beer, but not true to style at all, this almost feels like a black IPA in certain respects. But, more importantly: very good beer indeed.

Bottle at home. Aroma is coffee beans, hazelnuts, espresso, hint of chocolate, hops, malt, some citrus. Flavour is moderate sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium. Surprisingly hoppy espresso coffee beer with the nuttiness of a Brown Ale, tasty!

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Dark brown color with light brown head. Aroma has dark malts and sweet coffee. Taste is slightly sweet at first with really nice coffee notes and the finish is roasty and bitter. Body is soft but also well carbonated. Really good brown ale with nice coffee notes.

Bottle 0.33 l, ZUP, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe, mętnawe piwo z beżową, obfitą, puszystą i sztywną pianą oraz przyjemnym, kawowym aromatem. W smaku gęste, zdecydowanie kawowe z łagodnymi nutami czekoladowymi, lekko kwaskowe z przyjemną, chmielową goryczką na finiszu.
Pours almost black with a creamy brown head. Big mocha aroma. Taste also has chocolate and coffee notes, delicious.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, España.
A: Dark brown / Marron oscuro.
T/S: Roasted malt, sweet, coffee / Malta tostada, dulce, cafe.

Bottle from brewdog bar, Sheffield. Dark brown with a lacy cream head. Aroma is just like a morning pot of coffee on the nose, in the mouth its chocolate and coffee. Taste is sweet and bitter, surprisingly light and drinkable. Zingy and medium. Good.

Bottle. Brownish black beer with a strong foamy off white head. The aroma is quite milky and sweet, and the flavour is gently bitter with plenty of sweetness of a sugary nature. Overall ok but a bit too sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Čepovabné BeeerGeek. Tak tophle můu: kombinace výrazně hořké kávové chuti s jemným sladovým pozadím. Parádní Ale...Parádní spasitel...

Brown ale with nice head on top. Aroma has roasted malts, roasted coffee beans and maybe some light berry note. Taste is dry and roasted. Coffee beans and espresso. Medium body and medium carbonation. This beer stands to its name.

Pours a dark chestnut brown color with a 2.5 finger, frothy beige head that very slowly settles into a lasting cap/ring. The tulip is left coated with large streaks and chunks of soapy lacing. 

Robust coffee bean aroma with sweet and roasted malts balancing each other out. Roasted espresso/coffee bean along with dark chocolate and lactic sugar. Its nice to come across a coffee beer that doesnt smell like a week old used coffee filter. Some caramel, toffee and lighter chocolate balancing out the roast. 

Medium bodied with tight carbonation and a stronger roast presence than the aroma suggests. Lots of dry, roasted coffee bean flavor but it never becomes acrid or overbearing. Espresso like flavor with chocolate/mocha sweetness along with toast, toffee and oatmeal. Some lactic sugar sweetness but not as much as expected. Could use a bit more of that, in my opinion, to balance things out. Overall, this beer is decently balanced and easy to drink with nice coffee flavor but I didnt find anything that elevates it above an average coffee beer.

Spectaculaire mousse blanche et onctueuse sur un liquide qui me paraissait clair lors du service mais qui une fois dans mon verre savère est très foncé. Peu de lumière parvient à traverser ce liquide. Arômes très floraux sur base torréfiée. Vraiment un nez très distinctif ici où houblons floraux et malts rôtis se côtoient harmonieusement. Un nez qui pourrait me faire penser à une black IPA mais sans lattaque agressive de cette dernière. Cest à la fois intense, délicat et affirmé. Jaime beaucoup! Au fil des gorgées, le niveau de liquide diminue mais la mousse ne semble pas suivre tant celle-ci saccroche à mon verre avec insistance jusquaux rebords, même si le verre est maintenant à moitié vide. Clairement une bière qui a du caractère! Une bouche à lamertume intense et encore une fois florale. Torréfaction importante mais on demeure bien dans la brow ale ici, tant lamertume provient non seulement du houblon mais aussi dune juste torréfaction. Punchée mais toute en douceur, attaque intense mais finale douce, cette bière se boit franchement très (trop?) bien!

Bottle from BottleDog, Edinburgh. Dark brown body with a thin beige. Faint lacing. Aroma of coffee and roasted malt. Flavour of chocolate and orange. Thin to medium body with a creamy texture. Soft fizz. Solid.

33cl bottle from cerveteca lisboa, portugal. Dark red brown color. Thin medium beige head. Medium body. Dry finish. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Flavour is coffee, light cacao, light nutty, light milk.
pour nutty brown with a fine head. nutty, caramel, and chocolate aromas, taste light sweet, light bitter. medium bodied, lively carbonation,

Bottle in the Junkyard, Nottingham. Pours ruby with a nice cream frothy head. Fruity coffee aroma. The taste is plenty fruity too. Sweet with spice and red fruit and lots of coffee. Quite light bodied with high carbonation, but extremely tasty and a bit different.

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours brown with a beige head., Aroma of coffee, chocolate, cocoa, weak bitter nuts, some slight vanilla and some caramel sweetness. The taste has some coffee, nuts, some weak hoppy nuts, cocoa and a rather funny sweet end (weak Cola-like).

Pours haze dark brown with creamy stable light brown head.
Aroma without note of an alcohol and with hints of coffee, vanilla, cinnamon, chocolate and some fruits (pine, grapefruit, pinneapple, lemon).
Flavor is smoothy sweet, with hints of coffee, chocolate, oat, lactose, with hints of different (tropical fruits) and with bitter finish.
Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness is high, too high for that style, even for american style of brown ale-because of that, reminds me on black ipa style.
Body is sticky, carbonation is low, finish is long lasting fruity bitter.

Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement huileuse et aux notes crémeuses. Léger goût de noix grillées asséchantes avec des traces de chocolat au lait (faibles notes lactiques) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de malt rôti, un moyen goût de chocolat noir et des notes de caramel brûlé. Parallèlement, lon retrouve une amertume qui progresse tout au long de la gorgée et qui provient à la fois dun goût de café espresso et de houblon herbeux, légèrement floral et aux notes citriques, et ce jusquen finale. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de rôti, de café, léger de chocolat et de houblon herbeux avec quelques notes de noix.

Brown, tan head with thin retention. Nose is coffee, cocoa hints, roasted malt. Taste begins malty with caramel and cocoa, and ends with bitter coffee (with cream) and roasted malt. Slightly nutty finish with more coffee. Nice blend of coffee and beer.
Bought this for my boss for xmas. Dont even know if she likes beer but she does like coffee. She is brilliant though. This was nice, no bitter hop hit, but a lovely malty coffee choc balance. Good.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is coffe, malt, hop, chocolate. Flavour is coffee, malt, hop, chocolate, pine. Medium to full body. Nice beer.
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 330ml bottle. Dark red/brown color. Nice head, stays. Not much of aroma. Coffee beans, earthy, hops, sweet in flavor. Drinkable, but nothing special.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 330ml bottle (Drink Shop, Tallin) - shared by Ares, thanks!
Nice cocao mocha aroma. Same in the taste, more coffee than anything else. Smooth palate, but a little sticky. Chewy, even. Kinda ok, but not a great drink. Too sweet, and too much cocoa powder.
Scura riflessi ambrati buona schiuma persistente chicchi caffe piuttosto secca sentori erbacei quasi speziato amaro medio
Keg@ euaston Tap, heavy black with little head very hoppy yet intensely chocolatey and coffee like with a perfect level of bitterness great as a dessert drink wonderful stuff.

On tap at Euston Tap. Dark brown body with top head. Nose is coffee, malts, quite faint. Taste is roasty malts, caramel, sugar, sweet, lots of coffee in there. Bitter and spicy in the finish. Enjoyable for sure.

Pours pretty dark with a huge creamy head. Very little aroma. Taste is smooth, with a fair bit of hop bitterness for a dark beer. Not too sweet, but its there amongst the bitterness. Grainy coffee. Black pepper finish
Not too bad - was expecting something more creamy, but Im pleasantly suprised with the hop notes. Very drinkable nevertheless.

The thin and oily mouthfeel put me off, what could have been an enjoyable roasty brown ale. The coffee roast is warm and inviting, with some nice vanilla accents, but its surfing on a body of nothing. Look forward to trying again should there be changes.
021212. Bottle from Kris Wines at Hotel, London. Pours black with a nice semifrothy head. Aroma coffee, roasted malts, oat, hops. Slightly dry coffee like taste. Feels like a porter. Not Bad.

from Erzbierschof - very dark yet clear beer with a little persistent dark beige foam; solid and dry aroma of coffee; fairly hoppy; notes of pepper and tar; a good malt backbone, tasty, astringent and very bitter; pretty dry with a long coffeish aftertaste; long lasting with more notes of black pepper and prunes - accurate and very good

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Day Two. Pours clear, red-brown with a small, tan foam head. Nose holds some sharp coffee and dirt. Medium sweet flavor with nice, dirty coffee, very mild cocoa. Actually pretty sweet. Now more sweet coffee. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish with faint roasted malts, toasted sugars, light milk chocolate, some mocha. Surprisingly sweet in some ways. There are also some notes of ripe fruits like you would find in rich, dark coffee. Good.

Une jolie bouteille qui contient un liquide meilleur avant le 17/04/15.  Une robe qui sapparente à un cola avec une mousse brune assez large et moyennement résistante.  Un nez emballant de noix enrobées de caramel et de café doux.  Des houblons citronnées et résineux comme une récompense pour les narines.  Une bouche qui propose des malts bruns, du caramel et du chocolat doux avec des noisettes, du café et un ultime retour houblonnée qui arrive, ma foi, avec les meilleures intentions.  Une bouche bien constituée qui propose des bulles honnêtes et une texture huileuse.  Une finale amère de caffè mocha et de houblons à laméricaine.

on draft...poured a darkish brown color with no head. the aroma of dark roasted malts and a nutty scent...the flavor was quite nutty almost to the point of a nutbrown ale with a plug. quite tasty...love that roasted malt and nutty flavor...mild taste of a coffee almost had to look for it...pretty decent overall.

Bottle. Deep red-hued brown body, medium off-white head. Nose is intense mocha, roasted grains, ashes, hints of sour wheat-yeast-like tones. Pretty cool. Taste is mocha, dark chocolate, burnt toast, hints of toffee and brown sugar. Medium body and carbonation. Very nice mocha creativeness in a bottle from To Øl.

Reddish black colour, almost like a coke. Aromas to flowers and tropical fruits with coffee. The mouthfeel is more balanced to coffee, but the  hops are very present too. Medium bodied, with a dry and rough ending. Pretty good, but I expected more.

Tasted on tap @ Sf bar, in June 2012z
Aroma is very complex, licorice, barley, caramel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. A very dark brown almost black beer with sweet, rich floral coffee notes, chocolate and a roasted finish. Excellent!

This beer is definitely not a brown ale, it is a coffee stout. Please Ratebeer Sirs, update the profile!
So, this pours dark, black with brown/beige big foam head. Too much hazy with yeast pieces floating thus appearance only 2/5.
It smells, taste and aftertaste coffee.
This is huge, I like it!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Reddish brown with medium beige head, that lasts quite well.
First impression.. its real cold coffee.. not very strong but.. if I rate as beer then i would say
that aroma is very intense coffee, some chocolate, nice maltiness to enrich flavour. Bit fruity.
Not over sweetened with bitter dry coffee finish.
Interesting beer worth trying again

75cl bottle.  Small tan head, cola dark brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, coffee/roast, some espresso.  Taste is moderately sweet, coffee/orast, light caramel, bittersweet chocolate.  Medium-full body, low carbonation.

On tap at Express de Lyon, Paris. Black coloured, small to medium sized beige head, caramel in the nose. Slight roasted malt, bitter coffee and dark chocolate with hint of alcohol in the finish. Nice and pleasant.

Bottle at home 311012
Dark copper brown, clear, light tan frothy head with good lacing
Aroma - coffee, toasted malts, caramel, touch of grassy hops in the background
Taste - soft good quality coffee, toasted malts, caramel malts, touch of toffee, some bitter grassy hops in the background, nutty malts, alcohol very well hidden
Palate - medium carb and body, texture creamy. Finish fairly bitter soft coffee, smooth malts, bitterish coffee linger with some creamy toffee malts
Overall - I found this better when it was left a while and the head had dissipated - the creamy malts came through more in the finish. It was a good pleasant beer, but nothing amazing. They are right about the booze being well hidden.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou ádné "dojmy"

Bottle in the Queens Head. Poured dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is dominated by the coffee. Moderate body, flavour is of some dark chocolate and definite coffee but without a standard stout/porter feel to it, there is much of the brown ale left. Interesting more than brilliant.

Bottle at home (BOE) - 27/10/12.
Dark mahogony brown with a tan head that soon thins to a small surface pond.
Big coffee nose, roast malts, roast coffee, chocolate.
Tastes of bitter roast malts, coffee, hops.
Medium bodied with a bitter dry finish.
Decent.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from bierkompass.de. Very dark brown color with medium creamy beige head. Roasted coffee, dark chocolate in aroma. Taste, milk coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel. Coffee bitter finish. Nice.

Tap at Spuyten Duyvil. Pours clear deep black tea maroon. Muddy looking. Deep sepia. Wispy off white lace. Nose is green olives and raisins. Taste is roasty, milk chocolate, some dairy, some dirt. Palate is dense and dairy creamy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Ales by Mail. A dark brown/mahogany coloured pour with a healthy beige head on top. Rich roasty, malty, chocolate/coffee aroma. Tastes roasty, malty ,chocolate, coffee, mocha, slight bitterness at the end. Delicious, need to get some more of this one.

(From notes 5 Oct, 2012) Bottle. A very dark brown beer, close to black. Light beige -colored foam, fluffy, but settles fast. Smells like coffee, vanilla, maybe some liquorice? Bitter taste, carbonation is quite soft. Felt a little bit watery overall, not rich enough. Nice beer, though.

From the big bottle, its deep amber brown with ruby tones; plenty of lush tan foam. Sweet aroma of milk chocolate. coffee, toffee, light booze. Flavor is the same, with a hint of nut shell bitterness, sweetness rounds out the coffee (more than espresso) very nicely. The finish is a little acidic, but with coffee and hops.... cmon.  Medium bodied, smooth and mellow. Superb alternative to coffee/ mocha stouts. Its utterly quaffable.

Hazy dark brown, thin frothy small bubbly beige head. Toffee, caramel, nutty and malty. Roasted malty body, both a solid amount of bitterness and nutty sweetness. Dry spices in ending. Lots of flavour. Nice. (At Colins De Molen Tuesday Tasting)

Sample at the molen monthly tasting.
Thick tan head.  Coffee aroma.  Clear deep burgundy pour.  Nice coffee after taste.

Quite much pitch black colour, medium off-white head. Aroma is coffee, ashes, roasted malts and some mild nutty notes. Flavour is roasted old coffee with mild maltyness, ashes and some slight chocolate as well. A bit watery palate.

bottle from circle liquors. Pours mahogany with a huge off-white head, tons of lacing.  The aroma is chocolate malty-ness with a big coffee bean scent.  Taste is immense coffee up front with a nice coffee grind bitterness on the finish.  There is a little mocha taste as the brew warms.  Im a fan.. the only downside is an average aroma.
a lovely stout, simple but effective... full of dark malts, chocolat and som coffee (but more chocolat...) also some nice hops... it feels a bit too watery, but the finish is nice and full...
Dark brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of coffee, milk chocolate, toffee and pine-y/green hops. Roasted malty flavour with some grassy herbal hops

Bottle. Pours a brown color with a beige head. Aroma is of coffee, nutty notes, toasted malt, bready notes, the sugary lactose notes and caramel. The flavor follows the nose nice coffee and mocha flavors, bready notes, toasted malt, nutty notes, the sugary lactose notes and caramel. The body is medium with a creamy mouth feel. Overall a really nice Brown Ale, especially considering I dont really like the style.

A medium head that quickly dissipates and a black colour. Aroma is stunning with espresso and chocolate aromas, neither overwhelmed by any aroma of alcohol. Taste is surprisingly unique, with having a bitterness of a strong coffee, some sweetness and finally some of the alcohol coming through. Quite hoppy towards the end, but generally a very balanced combination.

33cl bottle from The Bottle Shop Canterbury.  Very dark brown with thick beige head.  Big huge powdery coffee aroma.  Wow now that is a hell of a lot of coffee.  I mean wow.  Smooth in mouth.  Some choc in mouth.  But the coffee is out of this world.  Wow.  Hops give it the hint of chocolate limes.  That is a hell of a beer.  Not many beers make me go wow these days, but this one did.  Wow.

33cl bottle bought at Cervezorama. Very dark brown colour with a beige head with big bubbles, nice lacework and good lasting. Aroma is licorice, coffee and roasted malts. Flavor is dark coffee, malts, slightly caramel and with a decent bitterness. The final is dry and maintain the same initial bitterness with a good duration. Carbonation and body are medium.
Pours dark unclear amber with a small White head. Lovely fresh grinded coffee. Mocha All over. A bit of ashes. Really Smooth and soft. Bitter and dry. A bit of Chocolate And Sticky hops.
0.33 l bottle. Dark reddish brown color. Aromas of grassy coffee, cocoa and nuts. Coffeish and nutty flavor with some sweet caramel and softly bitter finish. OK coffee beer.

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 17.04.2015
Aroma has lots of mocha coffee, some chocolate, nettles hints of gooseberry bush and ash. Flavour has mocha, some chocolate and nettles. A bit unpleasant, ashy and peaty finish. Lighter and more thin than I expected, but not bad anyway. With less hops this would be better.

(33 cl bottle from Bjergtrolden) Pours dark brown with medium, tan head and heavy lace. Decent retention. Aroma is ashtray and coffee. Oily texture, medium body, soft carbonation and bitter, roasted finish. Taste is not sweet, roasted and a slightly herbal bitterness. Aroma less pleasant than the espresso "stout" but the taste is slightly more pleasing. Head gets nicely creamy when you swirl the beer around in the glass a bit. Nice touch. Girlfriend says: "I prefer the other one."

Bottle from Drinkmonger. Pours dark, light head which is soon gone. Aroma is modest but is roasty and coffee like. Taste is slightly sweet at first (theres lactose in the brew), but very strong, dry , bitter coffee notes come through to dominate. Slightly thin for a beer of this strength. Finish is very long and dry with more chocolate coming through. Very good indeed, but a little one dimensional.

330ml bottle from Bierkompass
BBE 17/04/15 - Pours dark brown with a massive foamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, some fruity notes, hints of coffee and dark chocolate. Taste is malty, slightly toasty with some notes of coffee, nuts and fruits. Finish is smooth and creamy with a nice fruity hoppiness. Quite hoppy and fruity brown ale.

Bottle at home.
Clear orange-brown with a beige head. Aromamedium+ malty (coffee, chocolate, caramel, roasted), light hoppy. Flavor medium sweet, light bitter. Medium+ body.

The pour is a very dark brown with a moderately full, pale tan, fluffy, pillowy head which is somewhat lasting and leaves thick soapy lace.  The nose is pleasant with lots of nutty notes (roasted almonds, hazelnut), roasty but with restraint, a sharp grapefruit hop note, milk chocolate, buttered dark toast, maybe a light chocolate ice cream note.  The flavor is similar with plenty of resinous and sharp grapefruit which somehow is complementary to the coffee and chocolate notes, milk chocolate, earthy coffee roast, burnt toast, some peppery spice, and roasted almonds.  The palate is medium to full, silky, creamy, and nearly lively.  The finish is still very nutty, a hefty acidity from coffee and citrus alike, some spicy resins, and burnt toast.  The hop choices were evident with the resin and intense citrus notes but surprisingly did not contrast with the coffee and chocolate notes.  The acidity did become slightly overbearing by the finish but that is usually pretty standard for coffee beers.  I do not really see this a substitute from mocha coffee drink but it is interesting to see the coffee and hop notes meld well together.  An interesting beer to try.
Dark brown colour. Aromas of coffee, mocca and chocolate. Very nicely done.

Bottle @ Hj Hansen, Odense. Pours dark unclear amber with a small White head. Lovely fresh grinded coffee. Mocha All over. A bit of ashes. Really Smooth and soft. Bitter and dry. A bit of Chocolate And Sticky hops. Tasty stuff!

Yellow-amber, dense head over deep-brown beer. Outspoken coffee, but also quite fruity nose, red fruit. Stale cigarette ashes. Again ashes, coffee, with a creamy finish, enhanced to spritziness by the carbonation; but it does not really remind me of mocha, too dry for that. Faint, if quite nice, nearly lactic point of acidity in the very finish. Medium bodied at least, well-carbonated, long coffeeish aftertaste. Palate is its real forte, but its too fleeting, going over too fast in indifferent coffee.

330ml bottle.  Pours a hazy dark brown with a large head.  Aroma is bitter coffee, chocolate and fruity hops.  Taste has coffee and chocolate to start.  Bitter Simcoe hoppy finish with more coffee.  Lingering coffee aftertaste.

12oz bottle pours a translucent copper amber with some frothy off white head.  Nose is nutty, coffee grounds, Italian coffee, light brown sugar, stale coffee, bread.  Flavor is sweet, a touch spicy, coffee obviously, some brown sugar, stale coffee, light berry, some cracker.  Medium bodied, dry coffee finish.
Draft. Blackish beer with a dark tan head. Lactose and coffee aroma with malt. Coffee and lactose flavor with malt. Medium bodied. Coffee and light roast lingers with lactose backing.

From Skjold Burne, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 150812.
Dark brown with beige head. Aroma of coffee and malt. Flavour with caramel and roast.
Bottle from Euston Tap. Pours dark reddish brown with a patchy head. Tart bitter roasted coffee aroma. Full-bodied, good combination of malty sweetness with bitter roast. Good, but no hallelujah.

Capped 750 from Marcus. Pours really dark brown with a weird foamy/frothy beige/tan head. Aroma is very coffee over some pretty dark chocolate. Its just a little astringent, and pretty dry. Finishes chocolate and coffee! Very, very nice.

Bottled. Dark Brown coloured, dense light Brown head. Aroma of roast, Brown sugar, herbs, coffee, chocolate. Flavour of coffee, roast, chocolate, brunt sugar, herbs. Medium to full bodied. Ends on a roasted bitter note with a touch of coffee. Good one

Bottled. Opaque dark brown with a frothy, lively beige head. In the nose: Intensr milky coffee, roasted malts,dry dark cocoa. Roasted flavor, milk, coffee, chocolate, Hops, slightly acidic and medium bitter finish. Wellmade, very nice coffee profile.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark brown pour, creamy tan head. Aroma of coffee, roasty malts, creamy, toffee and caramel. Flavor is creamy sweet coffee with milk, fitting, given the name. Nice thick body, lively carbonation, nice balance. Quite full brew.

Shared bottle at local tasting. ABV is 7%. Dark brown colour, moderate beige head. Sorish and sharp aroma of lightly roasted coffee beans, some dusty, earthy and ashy notes. Very dry and ashy flavour first, not very good coffee, a little sweetness in the finish. Not my cup of tea / coffee / beer.

Flöska. Red brown colour, beige like head. Pleasant coffee in the aroma along with toasted malt, caramel and chocolate. Good mouthfeel. Flavour has coffee, toasted malt and caramel, some chocolate and citrus hoppiness.

Aroma: Complex smell, cold old grounded coffee beans, ash tray, honey, chocolate and peas. First off-putting, then interesting ...Appearance: A dark brown brew with hints of red, a tan high head, little lacing but good curtains.Taste: Brown bread is predominant, then coffee, old cold coffee, milk chocolate.Palate: Medium carbonation, small bubbles, oily and sticky, a good body.Overall: Very much coffee, actually a bit too much.Note: Bottle 330 ml at De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2012-8-11.
Bottle kindly provided by Ole Anders. Pours black as Coke with a huge creamy off-white head. Aroma is acidic, with some bitter coffee. Taste is smooth, bitter coffee, dry and lively mouthfeel.

Shared bottle kindly provided by my beer pal Ole Anders. Clear deep mahogany body with a short lived light brown head leaving excelleng lacing and a film. Dusty Turkish coffee pn the nose. Mouth adds bitterness. Medium to full body. Smoothish.

This is very nice. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. The aroma has a lot of coffee and some chocolate along with a bit of roast malt. The flavor is similar with coffee the dominant factor. Nicely balanced with a dry finish.

330ml bottle. Cloudy brown colour with huge, firm, frothy, well lacing, off-white head. Dark malty aroma with intense coffee and cappuccino notes in the background, a touch of roast. Taste is initially dark malty with intense, slightly sweet cappuccino notes, changing to more dry regions of the spectrum of coffee flavours. Lively carbonation interferes with the cappuccino notes in my opinion - maybe thered be too much coffee if it didnt.

Bottle. Pours brown with a big beige head. Aroma of malt, coffee, milk sugar and toasted malt. Flavor is sweet and malty with coffee, chocolate, nuts, licorice and sugar. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A clear, looking, reddish dark brown beer topped by a finger-thick, beige head. Lots of coffee on the nose, as well as lots of citrus-peelish, piney hops. Chocolate and some coffee grit too. Really wonderful. Unfortunately the flavor isnt equally exellent, but its still really pleasant.. A good hoppy bitterness in the back, citrusy, piney hops and a fine coffee flavor, but not as intensely as the aroma. Lasting finish with bitterness, coffee and roasted malts. If the flavor only was as good as the aroma... 120804

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear deep ruby brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, citrus and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long harsh coffee and bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle from OL Beercafe, Walnut Creek. Pours black with a huge light brown head that was hard to contain. There is a pleasant coffee aroma and a creamy chocolate and coffee flavor. Very tasty.

33cl bottle shared with Dutchdrebus. Nice deep dark red color, full sized off-white to beige head that lasts for quite awhile. Smell lightly malts, some coffee, hops, toasty. Taste malts, some coffee, hops and slightly roastyness. Medium carbo, low to medium body.
Bottle thx to benzai. Dark brown with some ruby redness, small off-white head. Smells hops, dark chocolate, lovely. Tastes hoppy, bitter, dark chocolate. Great carbo, medium body.

Dark brown crystal clear pour. Huge tan head. Slightly hoppy and coco aroma. Medium bodied smooth. Dull malty vanilla flavor

330ml bottle. Coffee  and sweet aromas. Pours dark brown, cloudy, with nice tan head. Medium body and soft carbonation. Taste is coffee, along with sweet flavours. Enjoyable, despite i do not enjoy coffee beers.
Poc aroma, però bona cremositat. Notes de cafè i torrats. Cervesa lleugera i amb un final molt agradable.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with tan head. Nose/taste of lactose, fresh coffee, sugar and moderately roasted chocolate malt. Finishes dryish lactose and fresh coffee. Medium body.
Bottle at Haket, on July 21, 2012Hazy dark red color, small light brown head. Acidic, coffee scent. Coffee, peppers, bitter taste. Spritzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
Tap at Fairbar, Aarhus.  Deep amber, off white head.  Coffee, light malt.  Thin brown ale with a hint of coffee.  My notes say meh which really sums it up.

33cl bottle. Poured dark brown, unclear, beige large head. Aroma has chocolate, moccha, coffee beans, lactose. Flavor has roasted coffee, molasses, malt and bitter hops. Sweet. Finish is bitter with lots of coffee. Enjoyed at breakfast, good way to start the day.

Bottle. Dark brown, hazy, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, light caramel and some roasted malt with some coffee, light chocolate. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, some caramel and some roasted malt, coffee with light chocolate. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, light caramel, roasted malt and lots of coffee, light piney hoppyness. Despite of roasted malt this one is still too sweet/too much caramel for me.

(Bottle, Ölbutikken, Copenhagen, 7 July 2012) Dark brown colour with foamy pale brown head. Roasted, malty nose with coffee, dark bread and ... well, its mainly coffee. Roasted, malty taste with notes of coffee, chocolate, citrus and a generous coffee bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, slightly sweetish. Lots of coffee character in this one. Nice.

Very dark brown beer with a nice sized head, sticks great. Mixture of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee. A good biterness that is not overwhelming, and the coffee-taste holds good. Better then expected.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2012 Tap @ Fairbar Aarhus. Deep brown appearance with a small tan head. Very roasty, dark malty, caramel, nutty, coffee aroma. Very roasty espresso, dark chocolate, slight char, burnt malty flavor.
Bottle. Small nougat brown foam. Dark brown. Strong toasted roasted coffe notes. Dry licorice full body with good carbonation. Delicious brew from the sons of mikkeller.
Tap at CBC. Hazy dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and fruit.
Creamy coffee on the nose. Creamy and sugary coffee liquor, coco beans and hint of bitter hops on the taste.

Nose: coffee, liquer,

cocoa with sweetness

330 ml botlle - thanks to to jvandooren - pours deep brown wih little head. Aromas of coffee, ports, some candi sugar. Light body, bitter & sweet well in balance. Taste is coffee

bottle at home ... Deep brown... thin tan head ... huge coffee roast ... dark malts ... ligth fizzz ... deep dark roast ... big malts ... lots of coffee ... hints of chocolate ... juicy roast ... nice ... real nice

In bottle at Craigs. Pours a very dark brown colour with a decent yellowish light tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, musty yeast, Weetabix and alcohol. Similar flavours with lingering Weetabix malt. Moderate carbonation, light CO2 prickle and a foamy mouth-feel. Mildly bitter also.

33cl bottle from Dranken Geers.
Brune légère, col fin beige.
Arôme me paraît plus houblonné laissant des notes de citron surtout quand la mousse reste présente, note de café en retrait avec une pointe de chocolat.
En bouche, aspect plus black IPA avec une belle note de houblons citronné rajoutant une fine amertume. brown but a bit transparent. Obvious coffee in the aroma. A bit unbalanced, there is nothing to back to coffee up, also bit lacking in depth. Not a bad brew but certainly something I can not drink much of. Shame, because I like coffee and beer!

Sampled at the festival. Pours a deep, dark brown body with nice creamy off white head/lacing. Aroma is chocolate, sweet cocoa, coffee, milk and toasted caramel malts. Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated, somewhat dry and medium to thin with notes of coffee, cocoa powder and light caramel.

33 cl bottle. BBE 17.04.2015.
Pours hazy dark red color with a frothy head, leaves a nice lacing behind. Aroma of chocolate malts, mild dark berry notes, fairly strong coffee, caramel and a hint of nuts. Flavor of sweetish sugar, dryish chocolate, bitter dark toasted malts, some ripe fruit notes and some coffee also. If I had more of this Id skip coffee in the morning and drink this.

Botella de 330ml. Vaso de ½ Pinta. Saboreada en jun´12. Color marrón rojizo y tintes rubí oscuro a contraluz. Espuma beige, cremosa con bastante buena retención y collares de encaje. En nariz, aromas intensos de café, maltas torrefactas, sutil fragancia floral y levadura. Maltas tostadas y amargor de madera con notas de café al primer sorbo. Seguidas por sabores de maltas dulces torrefactadas, chocolate y crema de leche. Paladar aterciopelado y cremoso. Cuerpo medio y sabroso. Carbonatación moderada/alta. Textura densa. Final amargo y prolongado con café dulce en el retrogusto. Más ligera que una Milk Stout, pero tan sabrosa como ella. El ABV no debe preocupar.
330ml bottle. ½ Pint glass. Enjoyed on ju´12. Reddish brown color, deep ruby to the light. Beige, creamy, froth. Fairly good retention & lacing collars left. Intense coffee, roasted malts, subtle floral & yeast to the nose. Toasted malts & woody bitterness with coffee notes at first sip. Followed by sweet roasted malt, chocolate & milky cream flavors. Velvet & creamy palate. Medium, flavorful, body. Moderate to high  carbonation. Oily texture. Long bitter finish & sweet coffee on the aftertaste. Lighter than a Milk Stout but as flavorful as it. ABV won´t bother you.
